resources:
AprilTag ViSP App Created by Akshay Sharma AprilTag is a visual fiducial system, useful for a wide variety of tasks including augmented reality, robotics, and camera calibration. This app computes the precise 3D position, orientation, and identity of the tags relative to the camera. \n\n The original AprilTag library is implemented in C with no external dependencies. This example uses an Android SDK which I developed as a part of my GSoC Project with focus on real-time performance Link to my GSoC Project
Settings Auto Focus
Turn on the camera flash?
Camera focal lens: Camera native resolution: Camera fov: Camera sensor size: Image resolution:
Camera focal: 600
Tag size (m): 0.1
Display the marker frame? Frame size ratio: 0.5
AprilTag quad_decimate: 2 AprilTag decision_margin: 50 AprilTag nb threads: 1
Validate This app is derived from the works of Akshay Sharma produced during the GSoC 2018 project and ViSP. The underlying detection method is based on the code from the AprilTag 3 GitHub repository. You can generate fiducial markers using the following online tool.
https://github.com/AprilRobotics/apriltag
